SENT.plain: The RS3PE syndrome or subacute edematous polyarthritis of the elderly remains a doubtful entity
We report three cases that exhibited different courses: complete recovery, definite rheumatoid polyarthritis, and chronicity as a sign of myelodysplasic disease
These three different courses raise the question of whether RS3PE is a disease or a syndrome
Actually, the use of the term RS3PE syndrome should be restricted to cases with a favorable outcome
Definitive diagnosis thus cannot be reached before complete recovery
